EIA Plant Identification number. One to: The EIA fuel code associated with the fuel receipt: https://www.eia.gov/electricity/2008forms/aaqs_923.html

fuel_cost * proportion_generation_by_generator; where fuel_cost = (fuel_quantity * average_heat_content  * fuel_cost_per_mmbtu) where: average_heat_content is mmbtu per unit of fuel_quantity & fuel_cost_per_mmbtu is all costs incurred in purchase & delivery of the fuel to the plant in dollars per million Btu(MMBtu)
fuel_cost / net_generation_mwh (calculated by plant and fuel type so values are same for generators with same fuel type)
proportion_generation_by_generator * fuel_consumed_mmbtu; where fuel_consumed_mmbtu is total heat content of all fuels consumed by the plant
Overall heat rate for each generator in MMBTU per Mwh of net generation (fuel_consumed_mmbtu_per_generator / net_generation_mwh_per_generator)

True (value = 1) if all generators are mapped to a boiler for a given year of plant data; False (value = 0) if generator data exists that is not mapped to a boiler in the boiler generator association table in EIA860
Net electricity generation in Mwh for all units that are part of the plant.
Total installed capacity for all units (coal or otherwise) that are part of the plant.
